translated: Praise of the Three Virtues of the Nestorian TeachingğŸ”½The unsurpassed heavens deeply respect and praise,
The heavy thoughts of the earth universally bring peace and harmony.ğŸ”½The true nature of humans relies on the support,
The benevolent father of the three powers, the Arhat.ğŸ”½All good assemblies sincerely pay homage,
All wisdom natures praise and sing.ğŸ”½All that contains truth completely reveres and looks up to,
Receiving the holy compassionate light, saved from the demons.ğŸ”½Difficult to seek, unsurpassed, correct, and eternal,
The benevolent father, the bright son, the pure wind king.ğŸ”½Among all emperors, he is the teacher-emperor,

Praising that wondrous bliss, illuminating this country.
The greatly revered and noble son Mishaka, widely delivering from the realm of suffering, saving the countless
King Sattva, with loving kindness like a lamb, enduring the suffering of universal indulgence without complaint
Vows to abandon the heavy sins accumulated by the multitude of beings, well protecting the true nature and attaining freedom
The noble son properly sits to the right of his father, his seat again surpassing the lofty and lofty
The great teacher wishes for the assembly to request him, to descend the raft and avoid being swept away by the burning river
The great teacher is our compassionate father, the great teacher is our noble lord
The great teacher is our Dharma king, the great teacher is able to universally save and deliver
The great teacher's wisdom power assists all the arrows, all the eyes gaze up at him without moving for a moment
Again, to the withered and parched, he bestows sweet dew, all those moistened by it have their wholesome roots nourished
The greatly revered and noble Mishaka, I praise my compassionate father, the ocean's compassion
The noble one's humility and pure wind nature, the clear and still Dharma ear is inconceivable
The three bodies above all return to one essence
